Strikes the ground, causing fire to erupt in a line in front of the player. Useful for dealing with a line of approaching mobs.
Does a 360 sweep around you with the range of a typical melee attack. Low attack speed gives enemies a chance to hit you after you use the weapon.
Strikes the ground, causing an explosion of electricity in front of the player. Moderately useful for killing groups of enemies, but cannot kill enemies behind you.

Has high attack speed and increases your movement speed when charged or active. Attacks a very small area right in front of the player. Knockback can cause an enemy to get flung out of range of the attacks, rendering the weapon useless.
Does two consecutive punches, sending out energy waves in front of the player at a medium range. Useful for an approaching mob of enemies or for dealing damage to the boss.
Does a horizontal swing and then strikes the ground in front of the player, which does damage in a small area.
Has high attack speed and increases your movement speed when charged or active. Does a large 270° swing roughly in front of the player with very high range and damage. Recommended weapon.
Firing consumes one charge and shoots two arrows in quick succession.
On hit, may* inflict a poisioned status on an enemy, which will do a few small instances of damage over time.
Shoots a large arrow that passes through all enemies. Any enemies in the arrow's path or close to the path will be killed.

Shoots an erratic arrow that, on hit, will inflict all enemies in a small area with the controlled effect. Controlled enemies will glow the color of the inflicting player and will start to attack other enemies. After some time, the effect will wear off and the mob will attack players like normal. Controlled enemies will not be targeted by pets but will still be attacked if they get within the pet's attack range. Arrows will still target controlled enemies. Controlled enemies will attack eachother, which makes it useful for escaping when you're surrounded by enemies. Controlled enemies will prevent players from progressing to the next level.
Fires a beam that reaches halfway across the map. While it's firing, you can aim it around and it will kill most enemies. Incredibly good for killing large amounts of mobs across the entire map.
Quickly shoots a large volume of arrows.
On hit, will affect all enemies in a small area with electricity.
Fires an arrow that bounces from enemy to enemy. Capable of taking out smaller groups of mobs in a single shot, and the arrow will even travel halfway across the map to hit an enemy. Fun to use.
Upon hit, a large field will be created that sucks in all enemies nearby before quickly exploding.
Will move torwards the enemies, attempt to do an attack, retreat, and repeat. If the enemy avoids the attack, then you can consider a whole cycle of the pet's attack to be "wasted".
Seems to have a ranged attack, but the AI bugs out often causing it to constantly engage and retreat with the enemies*.
Strikes the ground in front of the player, creating an explosion and damage within a medium* area.
Fires an arrow that, upon hit, will trap all enemies in a medium area in a bubble.
Shoots an arrow that will slowly grow and pierce through enemies.
Soul Hunter Crossbow (with Split Shot Quiver)
Functionally similar to the Corrupted Beacon, with some small differences. Range is reduced in exchange for a longer beam duration. Additionally, the beam itself looks similar to a guardian beam.
Behaves simiarly to the Iron Golem, but takes knockback damage, which causes it to often miss.

Will move in torwards the enemies and will continue to attack until there are no more enemies in range. The golem's large size makes it perfect at stopping large groups of mobs, and it also allows you use the golem as a shield to help protect yourself from damage. Also great a pulling aggro, which makes fighting certain enemies and bosses much easier. Recommended pet.
